1222322.title: Next

1223.content:
A low, grumbling noise echoed throughout the grasslands. The dire wolves, once sleepy and tired from their feast, got back onto their feet and left as quickly as they could in their present heavily-bloated state. The pack swiftly left the area leaving behind the remains of the bloated deer.

William wasn't sure what exactly was scaring off the dire wolves. But whatever it is must be dangerous to scare off such already terrifying creatures.

Our adventurer didn't have to wait long to see what was coming.

Out of the tall grasses came what had to be the biggest tiger William had ever seen. It was just as tall as any of the dire wolves, but its girth would have put them to shame. The tiger, as far as William could tell, must have been seven or eight feet wide. Its furry, creme-colored gut hung a mere inch off of the ground and jiggled with each of the tiger's step. The creature sported an impressively massive rump and thick legs most likely grown from having to carry around such a huge amount of weight. And just under the tiger's bright red mane was a tire of fat that covered its entire neck.

William watched in awe as the one-ton tiger slowly made its way towards the deer's carcass with each step causing the earth to shake briefly. The massive tiger saw the remains of the deer and immediately began to feast of the rest of the deer's blubbery belly.

As the tiger engorged himself on the carcass, William just stares at the tiger from behind the boulder. He had never seen a tiger that large before. It's astounding that the thing was still able to waddle around at its size. No wonder the dire wolves scattered.

Suddenly, William was struck with an idea. The tiger was massive and clearly had the size advantage over any opponent. But William had speed and agility. "I should be able to easily give the thing the run-around," thought William. "I could poke it in the rump and it will take a week for it to turn around and get me." A few quick stabs with his rusted sword and William should be able to best the tiger. And the bounty that big of a creature would bring him would be huge. Just the pelt alone should be able to fetch a nice price. Maybe some member of nobility needs a massive tiger-skin rug for the floor of his dining hall.

The tiger was finishing the last of the carcass. If William was going to attack, now is his best chance. What does William do?
1223.title: Well, it looks like there's something else ...

123.content:
After reviewing what he knew about the land, William felt compelled to go to the villages on the hills in the south. He wasn't sure why this was. The fox was never particularly interested in eating contests. These were events for bulky furs. A scrawny fur like him would never stand a chance in any kind of those contests. Nevertheless, he sensed an urge inside of him wanting to go south. Maybe this was adventurer's spirit getting the better of him. In any case, it wouldn't hurt to visit. Even if he found nothing especially exciting in the hill towns, then it wouldn't be a total waste of his time since they were only a day's travel away.

William set out the next morning for the south following a winding dirt road. It was a rather uninteresting trip; the only other fur he saw on the road was a trader heading towards the north.

By the time William made it to the hills, it was already the evening. In the distance was a ring of hills. Many of the local residents lived in homes they build on the hills. The majority of the commercial and community buildings were in the center flat plain that sat in the middle of the ring of hills. William knew that this is were he would most likely find an inn for the night and decided to head in that direction.

When he got to the town center, he noticed that there were no other furs on the streets. This worried William. He needed to find someone, anyone, to ask about the location of an available inn. As William stopped to assess his situation, he heard off in the distance the faint sounds of cheering and yelling. He rushed towards the noises.

Many of the area's residents had descended upon the town square. On the far side of the square was an elevated platform with a long table on it covered in empty pie tins. Three furs were sat at the table, each trying to swallow more and more pie. William realized that he had accidentally stumbled upon one of the south's famous eating contests and, since most of the town was here, he might as well stick around.

Though he was the furthest away from the stage, William easily made out the three contestants because of their sheer size.

On the far left sat a bull with thick, muscular arms that strained the sleeves of his shirt and boulder-like thighs that made his shorts skin-tight. The bull also sported a sizable paunch. A sliver of brown-furred belly stuck out from under his shirt stained with blueberry pig filling. The poor guy looked like he was going to be sick as he lazily shoved handfuls of pie into his mouth. A placard in front of him said 8.

Sat in the center was a kangaroo with light red fur. He, too, had a belly on him although it wasn't as large as the bulls. The roo was extremely bottom-heavy. His legs were incredibly flabby and his hips were so wide that William would not be shocked to find out that he need two chairs to support his width. Even the kangaroo's tail was thick and pudgy and fought for space against his massive rump. He was muzzle-first in a pie pan. The placard in front of him said 13.

And on the far left of the table was a massive orange and white fox, just like William. This fox was easily three times as wide as William and easily just as heavy. In general, the fox was fairly chubby but his gut accounted for most of his weight and looked like a white, soft boulder attached to an otherwise overweight fox. He was happily eating an entire pie hold it in both of his hands. The placard in front on his said 25.

"And time is up!" yelled a another fur on stage, clearly the host. "And your winner with 25 pies is Matthew! Give it up for your winner!" The crowd cheered as the fox raised his flabby arms in victory and two other muscular furs helped me out of his chair.

"And let's hear it for Troy and James! Nice try, guys! Better luck next time!" Troy, the bull, rushed off staged looking like he was about to be sick. James, the kangaroo, gave a brief wave to the audience as he got up and shuffled off the stage, clearly disappointed. Turns out that William was right about the number of chairs the roo needed.

Matthew, the massive fox, made his way off of the stage. A few members of the audience approached him in congratulations while the majority of the crowd dissipated. Just like the day before, William felt particularly drawn towards one of the contestants and he suddenly found himself searching for...
123.title: William Heads South

choices: "...take me to a Syrup Vine nest."
1232.content:
William found James several blocks away from the town square. He was sat on a bench; it dipped visibly under the roo's weight. The fox approached James and pointed out the only spare space on the bench . "Hey, is that spot taken?"

The roo glanced at William, then at the space he was pointing to, and shrugged his shoulders. The fox sat down on the bench and swore he heard it creak slightly.

"I saw you at the eating competition. Congrats on getting second place." said William.

"Second place is first loser." replied James, starring down into his lap. "I don't think I'll ever beat Matthew."

"Oh, don't say that. I'm sure that with enough practice that you'll eventually win." William said to reassure James.

"Yeah, that's what they keep saying. And each year I practice I go home with the silver and end up like...this." James gestured to his incredibly flabby lower half.

"That's not a bad second place prized." replied William. James chuckled at his joke.

"I'm James," the roo said, sticking out his paw. "I'm a second-rate eating competitor."

William took his paw. "William. Second-rate adventurer."

James' head cocked at William's response. "An adventurer? Really?"

"Well, I'm trying to be one."

"I might have a quest for you..." started James. "I'm looking for someone to..."
1232.title: A roo in need a a friend indeed

12321.content:
"I'm looking for someone to take me to a Syrup Vine nest." said James.

"Why on earth would you want to go to a nest of those things? Just one of them is bad enough. And I keep hearing stories about other furs being turned into syrup-blimps because of those things."

"Yeah! That's the point!" James exclaimed. "Those things pump their victims full of syrup. They stretch out their victim's belly to impossible sizes with their syrup. So, if I can get a bunch of them to work their magic on me, then I might stand a chance against Matthew in the next eating competition."

"If you don''t pop." said William. "Or, if you don't pop, then you'll need help rolling your massive roo butt out of there."

"That's where you come in!" replied James. "All you have to do is get those things off of me before I get too big and get me out of there."

"Again, if those things don't turn me into a fox blimp. What kind of reward are you offering?"

James looked to the ground. "Well, I'm pretty broke right now. But if you help me and I defeat Matthew, then I'll promise you half my winnings. Promise!"
12321.title: "...take me to a Syrup Vine nest."

choices: Buy some off the black market."
123212.content:
"Look, I'm sorry. But I can't do it." William began. "You want me knowingly place you in a dangerous situation, then place me in a dangerous situation to get you out of there, if I can get you out of there, and there really isn't anything substantial you can offer me for a reward."

The roo signed. "When you put it like that, I guess that what I'm asking is kinda unreasonable."

"No worries," said William, placing a sympathetic paw on one of James' gigantic thighs. "You just really feel passionately about winning that eating contest. But you can't risk your safety for it."

James' head shot up in a sign of inspiration. "Wait, what if there was a safer way to do it?"

"What do you mean, James? A safer way of getting you into a Syrup Vine nest?"

"No, no! I mean, a safer way of getting a Syrup Vine! If you could get a few of those things, then we just release them on me in a safe place and let them do their magic! We could even let them loose in my house! No, wait. We can let them loose in my bedroom so they'll blow me up, right on my bed! Then when I reach my limit, you come in hacking and slashing! Sure, I'll be a round roo for a while and my pant size will go up a few dozen sizes after all that sweet syrup digests, but think of how much my stomach will be able to hold afterwards!"

"Well, that is a better idea..."

"So you'll do it?" asked James excitedly. He started bouncing up and down, causing ripples to flow through his tree trunk thighs and bloated butt. The bench creaked under the weight of the roo.

"Woah, woah, woah. I don't even know where I could get a Syrup Vine." started William.

James thought for a moment. "Well, you could always...
123212.title: William declines

1233.content:
William found Matthew after the competition surrounded by fans giving him congratulations and celebratory belly rubs. He stood at the outside of the ring of supporters that flocked around Matthew. The obese fox saw William and made eye contact with him. He waved a pudgy hand in the air to beckon William towards him.

"I don't think I've seen you around this parts." said Matthew to William. "I would have known. We don't get many foxes around here."

"And where I'm from, we don't get many half-ton foxes." William replied jokingly.

"Maybe that should change." replied Matthew, scoping William's body. He noticed the larger foxes glances and blushed a deep red. "Are you new in town? I've got plenty of space in my mansion and wouldn't mind having company for the night. Would you like to join me? Most of the inns in this town are full this time of the year, and I've got to help a fellow fox out!"
1233.title: Matthew, the obese fox

choices: William avoids being dragged into the kitchen
William goes along with Matthew's dessert offer.
12331.content:
"Well, if you're offering, then sure. Why not?"

"Wonderful!" said Matthew. He signaled another fur nearby to bring him his carriage. A moment later, a large wooden carriage arrived at the town square being pulled by two giant horse. Matthew held open the door to the carriage for the smaller fox. When William was inside, Matthew wedged himself through the doorway and plopped himself down on the seat opposite of William. The carriage groaned under the weight of the obese fox before it slowly pulled away.

"Did you enjoy my little show back there?" asked Matthew.

"Show?" replied William.

"That eating contest. It's not really a contest for me. These days, I can easily eat way more than my competition. So, for dramatic effect, I'll try and make it look like someone might upstage me for once before I snag the victory for myself!"

"I didn't think that roo was going to beat you. You easily ate twice as many pies as he did."

"Okay, so I don't play it up all the time. I missed my second midday snack, so I was a bit hungry going in. And it takes a lot to get this baby full!" Matthew gave his rotund gut a slap. The jiggling and wobbling of the fox's belly mesmerized William momentarily.

"Well, I hope over twenty pies keeps a big fox like you full!" said William.

Matthew started lazily rubbing his extended belly with his left hand. "I dunno. I think I have room in here still. Which is good. I have a half dozen cheesecakes waiting for me. Maybe I can save a few for you."

"Thanks, but I can hardly eat a few slices of cheesecake, let alone whole cakes themselves."

"Yeah, that's what I thought when I was your size..." mused Matthew.

"My size?" He was astonished that such a gluttonous fox was ever as rail-thin as William was. Especially considering that the massive fox was almost too wide for his carriage; his meaty flanks brushed against the interior walls and his heavy gut jiggled uncontrollably after every bump in the road. "You used to be skinny? What happened?"

"That's for me to know," replied Matthew. "Maybe you'll find out. We're here!" The carriage grind to a halt. Matthew was the first to get out, though it took him a few minutes to squeeze his huge frame out of the carriage. William didn't mind this since it gave it a solid glance at the fatter fox's ample butt. When William got out, he only had a few seconds to admire the exterior of Matthew's house before the bigger fox grabbed him by the wrist and started dragging him inside.

"Well, I hope you hungry for dessert. I know I am..." Matthew says.
12331.title: Château Sté Matthew

choices: Later that night, William is awoke by a loud noise.
123311.content:
"Hey, listen!" said William as the obese fox tried dragging him down a hall in the mansion. "I've been traveling all day and I'm exhausted. Maybe I can take up your dessert offer another time? I'm dead on my feet."

Matthew turned his head and gave a suspicious look to William. "Alright, fine. I guess I'll have dessert alone tonight. As usual. But at least spend the night here. I never have that many visitors and I have plenty of guest rooms."

"If you're offering, I'd love to spend the night here. It sure beats staying at one of the local inns." Matthew hollered for a servant. A moment later, another orange fox appeared. A slim and trim fox donning only leather briefs appeared.

"Take him to one of the guest room. I'm off to have dessert." Matthew then addressed William. "Good night, William. I will talk with you later."

William followed the servant fox down a series of hallways, wondering why the servant was so scantily clad. But before he could ask any questions, they had arrived at the guest room he'd be staying in. It was furnished with a plump bed, a fireplace with a roaring fire already started for him, and washing basin.

Our adventurer turned to thank the servant, but he was already gone. So William shut the bedroom door behind him, undressed, cleaned himself in the basin, and went to bed.
123311.title: William avoids being dragged into the kitchen

1233111.content:
A loud crash down the hall from his guest room woke William in the middle of the night. He peeked out the window of his room and noticed the moon high in the sky. It must has been just after midnight. William didn't know what that noise was, but he wanted to investigate. The embers of the dying fire in the fireplace still provided a faint amount of light. The fox went searching for his clothes but couldn't find them. The servants might have taken them for washing, William figured. So he took one of the smaller blankets off his bed and tightly wrapped it around his waist.

Carefully opening his bedroom door, the fox peered down both ends of the hall. On his right, the hallway extended off into the darkness. But on his right, around the corner, William noticed a light. He headed towards that part of the hallway, turned, and saw clear at the opposite end of the hall he stood in was a doorway flooded with light. Another clattering noise rattled down the hall. This must be where the noise is coming from.

Slowly making his way down the hall, more bangs and clattering came from the room. William was nervous. This wasn't his home and he didn't know what kinds of things went on here. He reached the doorway and peered inside.

William had found the mansion's kitchen. Dozens of cupboards lined the room's walls, a large kitchen island occupied the center of the room and on it were various kinds of knives and kitchen tools. Several sizes of cauldrons occupied another side of the room.

But what immediately caught William's attention were the two huge furry globes of fat. Three feet across each, both looking as if they were made of bread dough, and an equally orange tail gently wagged in the air. Under the mounds were two thick tree trunks of legs. This was clearly the rump of a particular rotund fox.

"Matthew?" asked William. The fox was leaning down and looking deep into one of the cupboards below him. Raising himself up out of the cupboard, William got a clear view of his fat back and haunches which formed into massive lovehandles. The obese fox turned around, hold two larges bowls, one in each arm. Matthew's front was just as bare as his backside, but at least his gut hung so far down below his waistline that any embarrassing situations were avoided. The fox's gut was a gigantic, white furred sphere with two pillowly moobs resting gently on top of them.

"Oh, hey William." The obese fox waddled towards the kitchen island and set both bowls down on it. William saw that they were filled to the brim with thick brown substance. Matthew grabbed a couple of the stools surrounding the island and set them right next to each other. The fox lowered himself onto the stools, each one bearing one of this oversized legs. "You here for a midnight snack too?"

"No, I just heard something crash and I figured that I'd check it out." Our adventurer replied.

"Ah, that was probably me." Matthew said. "The servants hid the chocolate pudding from me, so I have to dig around to find it." He waved his pudgy hand towards a stool opposite to him. "Please, sit."

William sat himself on the other side of the island. "Why are your servants hiding pudding from you?" he asked. The bowls Matthew had found were the size of standard salad bowls and completely full of pudding.

"It's because I'm starting to get too big." Matthew started. "All of these eating competitions are catching up to me. I'm really getting too fat to move around. So my servants hide food from me to make sure that I don't lose my mobility as soon. But I just love food too much." The obese fox lifted up one of the bowls to his mouth and started pouring the contents into his mouth. William could do nothing but stare in amazement as he watched the fox opposite to him chug down the giant bowl of pudding in a matter of seconds.

Matthew set the now-empty bowl down; chocolate stained his muzzle as he let out a low, rumbling burp.

"Which is why I need your help." said the obese fox.

"What? What do you mean? How I can help? Do you want me to help you lose weight or something?"

Matthew laughed, rippled were sent through his entire flabby body. "Oh no. I'd never lose a pound. Here's what need. Some ways away from here, there is a sorcerer. Or maybe he's a warlock. Or a wizard. I don't know and I don't care. But this guy has some seriously great enchanted items. And there's one that I want. There's a particular necklace that he has that makes the wearer weightless. I think he may had made it for traders who carry with them heavy loads like gold or gems. Well, I'm not a trader but I'm carrying a lot of weight. So what I want you to do is get that necklace for me. That way, I can keep eating all I want and still be able to walk around on my own. What do you say?"
1233111.title: Midnight Snack

choices: ...I'm looking for another fox to be the heir to my eating contest throne."
...I'm looking for another fox to be one of my servants."
123312.content:
The obese fox had a firm grasp on the much thinner fox's wrist. So even if William didn't want to accept Matthew's invitation, he had the feeling that he would be dragged into it anyways. Matthew slowly waddled through his mansion, and this greatly annoyed William. He clearly recognized how massive the other was. But Matthew was moving at a snail's paces because of all the extra fat he was carrying around. William could have easily walked through the mansion faster if he wasn't being pulled along by Matthew, so he just had to endure the annoyance of having to walk alongside a much slower fur.

After what seemed like an eternity, the two arrived at a lavish living room. Paintings of fruit bowls and natural landscapes covered the walls, plush red carpet covered the floor, and in the center of the room were two massive couches. Matthew let go of William's wrist and slowly plodded over to one of the couches. He lowered himself on the couch and William could hear the springs and frame of the piece of furniture groan under the weight of the fox. Matthew's flabby flanks touched both ends of the couch.

William settled into the couch opposite of Matthew. Suddenly, the doors to the living room opened and in came two other male foxes, one of whom was pushing a large cart with several covered trays on it. He immediately noticed two things about these other foxes: Both were just as skinny as William, and he knew this because both were wearing only black leather briefs equipped with a hole in the back of them to allow their tails to slip through.

Without a word, both of these new foxes approached Matthew and started to undress him. They both pulled off the tent-like shirt the fox was wearing. This exposed Matthew's gigantic gut to William. The shirt was tight and didn't leave much to the imagination; William could have already made out every single roll on the fox. Now, he could see the white fur of Matthew's gut and the two pillow-sized moobs that hung on top of it. The servant foxes removed Matthew's pants, freeing his thunder thighs from the trappings of the pants. William didn't know if Matthew was wearing any undergarments, but it didn't matter since the obese fox's gut covered his nether regions.

"Hopefully this doesn't make you uncomfortable," said Matthew. "But I felt like I was wearing a sausage casing all day in those things. Besides, this is my house, after all. And shouldn't a man feel free to show a little fur in his own him?"

"I would suppose so," began William. "But..." His eyes wandered to the servants.

"Oh, them? Well, I don't want to feel self-conscious. Besides, you like the uniforms, don't you, boys?" The two foxes nodded in agreement. "Well, aren't you going to serve dessert?" The foxes went to the cart and uncovered several trays. Under each one of them were massive cheesecakes, each one easily sixteen inches in diameter. One of the foxes grabbed a couple of the cheesecakes and headed towards Matthew. The other took a single cheesecake and a fork and gave it William. Then, he also went over to Matthew.

A servant fox on either side of him leaning into his fleshy side, each with a cheesecake in hand. Matthew opened his mouth and one of them quickly grabbed a slice and shoved the entire thing into Matthew's mouth. He chewed a few times and swallowed the piece, opening maw for another piece. In an instant, one of the foxes had a piece ready for Matthew to chow down on. This process repeated until only a single slice remained. As the obese fox reached his mouth out for the last slice, he notice his guest staring in disbelief. Rather than eating his own cheesecake, William had only taken a few bites. He was instead mesmerized by the display of gluttony in front of him.

"Like what you're seeing?" asked Matthew. "I hope so, because..."
123312.title: Dessert with Matthew

choices: Run! Don't pay attention to what the shaman is doing
A potion that fill him up with food
A staff to keep making William fat
124.content:
William decides to make his way east towards the supposed village. The grasslands were surprisingly open and event free as the fox could barely see something in the distance. As he does so, a soft rattle makes William jump and unsheathe his sword, looking around.

The fox doesn't see anything threatening, except one lapine figure someways off, who had their back turned to him. William crouches, before carefully padding to the rabbit. Just as he was about to get their attention, she turns around, looking face to face with William, who falls over and drops his sword.

The rabbit had a golden tattered coat that hid most of her brown fur. Some medicine bags and potions lied at her feet, but no weapons to be found. The fox sheathes his sword and tries to talk to her, although the conversation was more one sided as the bunny didn't understand him.

Just as William was about to leave, the shaman says a small chant and waves a paw. Almost immediately the fox doubles over, curling forward and putting a hand to his gut, feeling it start to grow out mysteriously. A layer of fat was swelling over his tummy, giving him a chubby look. He turns around, seeing the shaman reach down for....
124.title: Of Shaman and Wildlings

choices: Draw his sword and charge the shaman!
Sneak away in the tall grass.
Run away as fast as possible!
1243.content:
The rabbit shaman drew a short staff from her tattered coat and began chanting. The staff was of dark rosewood and carved with intricate runes- runes which, William noticed, were beginning to glow with an eerie light. The shaman planted both of her feet apart and her chanting grew louder. She let go of the staff as it began to float in the air in front of her and the tall grasses in the field whipped about as if buffeted by a strong wind.

William hesitated, momentarily forgetting his place in this situation as he was in awe of witnessing magic for the first time. This cost him.

With a loud -!-CRACKOOM-!- a bolt of pink light shot from the staff and hit William dead center, knocking him off his feet and backwards into a small ditch. The fox landed solidly on his back. Despite the pain, he couldn't help but notice the slight wobble to his recently chubbed up belly. Having the wind knocked out of him he gasped and tried to right himself, but found it more difficult than usual with the added weight. Weight which- his ears flattened as he observed- was still climbing, fat spreading out his stomach and elsewhere as his increasingly tightened clothes were indicating.

"M-Maybe it was a clothes shrinking spell?" He muttered with delusional optimism as he stood up in a low crouch. His position in the ditch kept him out of line of sight for the shaman's magic, or at least William hoped it did. But what was he going to do now?
1243.title: A staff to keep making William fat

choices: See the raccoon mage. What's he got?
Pick up a trinket. Maybe it'll be magic!
Head to a food-cart to spend some gold.
125.content:
Realizing that a simple sword wouldn't help him get very far if he faced a serious threat, William decided to walk into the shopping center. As he wandered in, he was approached by a mysterious round figure clad in a black cloak, who slowly walked by, motioning for the fox to follow him. "Have you ever been here before?", the cloaked figure grunted. "No... wait, who-" "Don't worry about me. Got any money?" "No, I-" "You're a brilliant one. If you even look at someone wrong, you could end up with your ass kicked... or worse." The mystery fur thrust a bag into William's hands. "Here." "What's this?" "A small fortune. Just wanted to protect a newbie, can't have someone eating your butt up. Just so you know, I meant that literally, not figuratively." The cloaked figure began to walk away from the confused fox before suddenly tripping, his massive bulk slipping out of his black cloak to reveal a huge panda, sheepishly running away. You look at the gold again: looks like he fenced it from someone with the initials "F.F.," as that's what the bag's side reads in marker. Glancing around to make sure this "F.F." wasn't about to bumrush him, William grabbed a handful from the sack and dropped the rest still in the bag. If "F.F." found it, he wouldn't be TOO mad, right?

Dozens of tents of every color, each with its own fur merchant selling his or her wares, spanned a vast plowed section of the field. As the fox wandered among the crowd, he heard shouts from vendors of every kind. One offered exotic treats and sweets guaranteed to put ten pounds on someone or their money back; another offered magical spells, the raccoon mage occasionally throwing a spell at a passerby, showing off his skills by shrinking, growing or transforming the confused target for about ten seconds before the effect wore off and they returned to normal. Others offered every kind of potion, clothing or trinket imaginable, all extolling that theirs were the best. Making a makeshift coinpurse out of an abandoned piece of cloth, William began to look for something to buy.
125.title: The shopping center

1251.content:
"What are you selling?" William asked the raccoon mage.

"Spells and incantations for those who can afford them!" the mage replied cheerfully. "I'm have all sorts of trinkets and spells that any aspiring adventurer might want!" He waved his hand across the table in front of his tent where dozens of different kinds of items were spread out on it.

William picked up a random ring off of the table, raising an eyebrow. "I don't know," he said. "I heard that this magic stuff is just a bunch of bunk."

The raccoon mage looked upset. "Is that so? Well, get a taste of my favorite expansion spell..." The mage waved his hands in a series of gestures. Suddenly, a cloud of blue sparkles popped into existence and flew right into William's face. William flinched back and brushed off his face. He waited a couple of seconds and found that nothing had happened.

"See? Just a bunch of bunk." said William.

"Oh, really?" the mage asked. He glanced over the shoulder William's shoulder. William looked behind him and noticed that, in fact, the spell had worked; his rump was noticeably larger.

William's cheeks burned bright red in embarrassment. "Okay, fine, what are you selling?"

The raccoon mage looked smug. "Consider that a free sample. I'm selling anything that's on this table. Prices are in front of each item."

William scanned the table and was disappointed to find that he could only afford three items: a plain gold ring, a throwing knife, or a simple black leather collar.

"What do those things do?" He pointed out the only three items he could afford.

"Ah, the ring is quite handy. It prevents the wearer from popping. So if you get trapped by a Syrup Vine, you'll be able to drain the thing dry before you pop. What you do as a giant, syrup-filled fox at that point is beyond the powers of the ring. That throwing knife is tipped with dire wolf poison. You know how dire wolves hunt, right? They stab their prey with their claws and the wound blows them up to massive proportions. The same will happen to whoever you use that on. It's a single-use only, and be careful not to poke yourself with it. And, well, I'm not sure what exactly that collar does. One of my men brought it back from an adventure, and I know that it has some magical properties, but I haven't pinpointed what it does just yet."

"Isn't that irresponsible to sell magical items that you don't know what they do?" asked William.

"I'm just looking to get rid of it." replied the mage. "So are you going to buy something or not?"
1251.title: See the raccoon mage. What's he got?

choices: Remember hearing of an eating contest?
12511.content:
William had to think. They were all decent items. He had to choose one though since the cheapest thing was worth half his gold, it being the ring. Plus, the ring could keep him from dying. What good is a bloated enemy compared to just a stabbed and bloodied one? Also, who wanted to really risk the collar?

"Alright, I'll take the ring I guess." He said while trading it for his coins. The ring itself looked decent with a green gem on the silver band. He slipped it on his middle finger as the raccoon let him go for a bit of advice. "Just so you know, kid, you won't be able to digest anything until you sleep. Your body is pretty much infinite storage. Try not to steal stuff or the guards will confiscate it."

William shrugged and walked off with the ring and the already forgotten plumped up rump, having some uses for the ring.
12511.title: The one ring to inflate them all.

choices: A sandwich; best not to get carried away at first
A dozen donuts; they're the same price as two, why not?
A calzone; you won't eat it all, but it smells delicious
1253.content:
Quickly locating the food court, William held his stomach as it growled in anticipation. He hadn't had much to eat; he wasn't quite ready for a feast, but he could definitely eat. Plus, if he ate too much, he was skinny anyway; it'd be a while before the famed weight gain of the area could do any real damage, right?

As he walked around, comparing prices, he saw a pattern. A sandwich was one gold, but three were only two; cake slices were two, but a full cake was only five. Most of the food was priced like that; the smaller portion was only slightly less than the larger portion... as far as some places' definitions of "portion." The "calzone" stand just folded a pizza in half, adding multiple fillings and stuffing them with cheese. Donuts were nearly a foot wide, and were in bulk for low prices.

As William re-counted his gold (it appears he had made off with about 60 pieces), his hands felt an odd sensation after they had handled the coins, the feeling spreading to his stomach after he took another whiff of delicious food smells. It went away after about ten more seconds, leaving William wondering what had happened. Was he hungrier? Had there been something up with the coins, or did he just imagine that? Taking a minute to sit down, he refocused his sights on his desired meal...
1253.title: Head to a food-cart to spend some gold.

choices: Find that panda and demand some answers!
Venture back to the center, see if William can find a cure
12532.content:
The orange fox sauntered over to the donut shop he had seen, with the massive cakes that had looked delicious. The 350-pound wolf baker behind the counter seemed shocked when the lithe vulpine ordered a dozen, but when he took out his gold, the cook's expression changed. For four gold, William had himself a dozen donuts, all in a box two feet wide and four feet long.

After a brief walk outside the center's gates, William relaxed, sat down and opened the box. One dozen triple-glazed hubcaps, half stuffed with chocolate, stared him down. Meekly, William picked up the first choice- banana nut chocolate, one of the place's specialties- and chomped down. It felt like heaven for the young kit, who savored the first bite for nearly a minute before swallowing. Greedily, he began to tear away at the defenseless donut, vanquishing it in a minute. Hungrily, William snatched a second calorie-laden dish, this one filled with thick chocolate filling, and took a massive bite, sucking some of the cream into his mouth.

Gasping for breath as he downed the final bite, the young fox snapped to attention for a moment, wondering what had gotten into him. Two donuts in two minutes was a record for him, especially when they were each the size of four themselves. Glancing at the box to examine the remaining ten treats, William did a bit of a double-take. It appeared that they had grown a few inches each! The box's sides were pushed close to their limits, and the fatty delights pushed against one another. "That's strange," he thought, rubbing his belly. Though it had just been filled with two huge baked goods that should have given him a food coma, it looked slightly puffier, if not noticeable yet.

Resuming the feast, William grabbed the third donut, giving it a glance-over before he downed it. It seemed a bit bigger, but not really, right? Assuming it was nothing, he savored his bites, though a growly stomach meant he finished it quick. He looked down at the box again. Yep, the donuts were growing, this time bigger than before. They were eighteen inches around... like the extra inch that had made its way onto his midsection. What's worse, he was hungrier than ever.

Painfully hungry yet passing limits he didn't know he could pass, William forced down the fourth and fifth donuts, both stuffed with Nutella. Keeping his eye on the box, the fox could clearly see the remaining donuts bulge slightly bigger each time, and his body followed suit. The weight stopped going to his gut and started spreading out, slowly filling his arms and legs as he ferociously gained speed in his uncontrollable weight gain.

By the time William had gulped down the ninth donut, each of the three remaining pastries in what used to be a cardboard box were well over two feet in diameter, while the orange fox's general figure had done half that. His puffy, rounded gut hung a few inches off his chest and just as many out and around, while his tree-trunk legs and thick arms swelled. "It had to have been the coins," he thought as he automatically tore the first few bites of the tenth. Shoving the donut in his mouth and carefully eating it, he grabbed the coins, each now emblazoned with a figure of a fattening fox. "That panda must have done this to me," he thought, "but since I'm finishing these donuts, I might as well enjoy porking out before I chase his fat ass down." Pushing himselff to the limit, William finished the eleventh and twelvth donuts, each three feet wide, in what has to be a world record for finishing two three-foot-wide donuts. Struggling at first to stand up, the fox had found out why the rumors were true about this place- thanks to the magic of a stranger, he had gone from 150 pounds to 550 in an hour.
12532.title: A dozen donuts; they're the same price as t...

choices: Give Luke the rest of the calzone
12533.content:
William hadn't had a calzone in years. And while the calzones they served up here would easily be dinner for a skinny fox like William for the next three days, he felt like he was on the mood for one. Worst case scenario, he could eat it over the course of the next few days.

He approached the calzone stand. Operating the stand was a polar bear, easily a foot taller than William with a sizable belly which strained his flour-covered apron. He was talking with another fur, a cheetah. The cheetah stood just as tall as the polar bear, but did not have an ounce of fat on him. Rather, he was heavily muscled and the cat's clothes looked skin-tight on him. William could make out every curve and ripple on the cheetah from his bulging pecs and define abdominals to his sculpted calves and luscious glutes.

"Um, excuse me?" William asked. "May I have one of those calzones?"

The polar bear and cheetah exchanged skeptical glances with each other. "A calzone? Did I hear you right?" the polar bear asked.

"Yeah, a calzone! I'm really in the mood for one!" replied William.

The cheetah looked at William up and down. "You sure you want one of those?" he asked. "I doubt a skinny little fox like you could take one of those on."

"Hey, I didn't ask for your opinion..." said William.

"Who said I was giving my opinion? It's just a matter of fact that you couldn't fit one of those monsters in that non-existent belly of yours. I can barely take one of those things on, and I've got all this to maintain." The cheetah gave his biceps a quick flex.

William blushed slightly at the cheetah's display. "Whatever, I don't care what you think. I'm having one anyway."

The cheetah gave a smirk. "Well, look at you. Fine, get your calzone. Actually, you know what?" He turned to the polar bear. "Lou, get this guy a calzone on me. I want to see scrawny-butt over here take it on."

"Alright, if you say so." said Lou, the polar bear. The vendor got a calzone from the display case, quickly wrapped it in paper, and handed it to William who needed to hold it in both of his arms.

"Thank you," William said to the polar bear before shooting a glare at the cheetah. He marched over to a nearby table, sat down, and unwrapped his calzone. William grabbed a chunk of it and started munching on it.

The cheetah sauntered over to the table and sat opposite to William. "Tasty?" he asked.

William shot him another glare. "Yes." A few crumbs escaped his full mouth when he talked. The cheetah tisked in response.

"Only pigs speak with their mouths full," he said. William didn't bother responding.

After around ten minutes, William was finished with only a quarter of the calzone and the cheetah mostly sat in silence watching him eat. The cheetah stuck out his hand. "Luke. My name is Luke. I probably should have introduced myself before buying you lunch."

William suspiciously eyed his paw, but shook it after a few second. "William." he said, after swallowing another mouthful of calzone. Once more, he grabbed another chunk of the calzone and stuffed it into his face.

Another fifteen minutes had past and William was only finished with half the calzone. But his gut felt absolutely stuffed. His normally flat stomach had bloated out to the size of a basketball and was just a firm. As he eyed the rest of the calzone, William just panted as he stared it.

"Getting full?" Luke asked smuggly. William said nothing in response. Then, Luke reached his hand towards William's face and ran a thumb nearby his mouth. He pulled it back and Luke's thumb was covered in tomato sauce.

"Sorry, you had a little something on your face." Luke said sarcastically before licking the sauce off his thumb. William blushed at this. "So, do you need help finishing it, or do you think you can take on the rest?"
12533.title: An Irresistible Calzone

125331.content:
William slid the rest of the gigantic calzone over to Luke. "Let's me show you how it's done!" Luke said. He grabbed to half-calzone with both hands and started devouring it. Within seconds, Luke's muzzle was stained with meat and pasta sause, but that didn't slow him down. He swallowed mouthful after mouthful with haste; William wasn't sure he was even chewing at all. In a matter of minutes, the half-calzone was gone. Luke opened his mouth and a low, rumbling burp came out. He lifted up the bottom of his tunic to reveal a taunt curve that replaced his defined abs. A smirk appeared on Luke's face as he gave his belly slow, circular rubs.

"Opps, sorry." said Luke with false sincerity. "How are you doing, foxy?" William was still majorly bloated and could only moan in response. "Poor guy. One day you'll be able to take of these things on. Stay here, I know what'll help you out." Luke got up from the table and walked to another food vendor off in the distance. William took this as an opportunity to rest his head on the table and try to sleep for a minute.

The slamming of the beer stein on the table woke William back up minutes later. "Drink," asserted Luke. He hadn't bother cleaning the sauce off his muzzle.

"Thanks, but I'm still really fu-"

"Drink." Luke demanded. When he sat back down at the table, he took a long drink from the mug, easily downing half its contents. When he pulled the stein away from his lips, he gave off another deep burp.

William looked at the beer mug in front of him. It look as if it just contained a simple ale. He meekly raised it to his lips and took a gulp. The moment he stopped drinking, he felt the sudden need to burp. He tried stifling it, but an eruption of gas still came out of his mouth. "Opps..." said William. He noticed, however, that his stomach felt a little better. Still present was the sensation of fullness having eaten such a massive meal, but the pain associated with it was going. In fact, William thought he might have been able to eat a few more bites of that calzone if Luke hadn't finished it off.

"Good stuff, eh, foxy?" said Luke. Another series of gulps, another series of burps from Luke. William followed suit, finding that each drink of the ale made him want to burp, and with each burp his belly felt significantly less pressure. When he finished his mug, William's belly stuck out significantly making him look as if he was six month pregnant. Luke, too, was even more bloated than before, though William was quick to note how the curve of his belly complemented his bulging pecs.

"Look at us, a fox and a cheetah acting like a couple of pigs." said Luke, a paw slowly swirling around his exposed belly button. "How about dessert, foxy?"
125331.title: Luke finishes it off

info.brief_description: William is a young fox travelling for adventure but he won't be gaining just experience!
info.description:
This is the Story of William, a teenager anthro fox who decided to travel in the Fattening World for adventures
He's Smart, Tall and has a Normal height at the Beginning, Green Eyes, Black hair and orange fur
He can have Partners
He can be the Feeder or the Fedee, Inflation is allowed but he can't die (if he pops/bursts he will appear in a Church in a Close Village, totally cured but a bit thinner)
Sex is allowed try not to make it graphic (implying is better though)

Well that's all folks!

PD: A lot of thanks to the guys adding chapters , I really loved the other options :D
